abstract.text: Sets up the specified codec to perform a data format translation.

inlineContent.text: An audio codec object. Because an audio codec object is a Component Manager component instance, you can use the Component Manager (for example, the functions
and OpenAComponent) to obtain an audio codec object.
A structure that describes the format of the input data. See

for a description of this structure and the values of constants that can be used in this structure. If the input data has a variable number of frames per packet, this structure is supplemented with the
structure passed in the
parameter of the
function.
A structure that describes the format desired for the output data.
Magic cookie data, if required for the input format.
Size in bytes of the magic cookie data, if any.
Returns
if successful. Returns
if the codec cannot handle the specified data translation.  See
for other possible values.
This function allocates any buffers needed, sets the input and output formats, and puts the codec into the initialized state. The codec has to be in the initialized state for the
and
functions to work. While in this state, the format information for the translation cannot be changed; you must call the
function before making any changes.
A codec’s properties provide information about allowable types of input and output, magic cookies, and so forth. Use the
function to read a codec’s properties. The properties are described in
and
If any argument is

, any values previously set for that argument are used. For example, if you are using the same codec repeatedly with the same input and output formats, you only need to enter the formats the first time you initialize the codec. After that, you can uninitialize, change property values as necessary, and then call this function again with
in the
and
parameters before processing the next set of data.

abstract.text: Record or play audio, convert formats, parse audio streams, and configure your audio session.
Properties that can be set or read on an instance of the audio codec.
These read-only properties disclose the capabilities of the codec and remain the same for all instances of the codec.
An instance of a Component Manager component.
Appends audio data to the codec’s input buffer.
Retrieves the value of a codec property.
Sets up the specified codec to perform a data format translation.
Retrieves output data from a codec.
Flushes all the audio data in the codec and clears the input buffer.
Moves the codec from the initialized state back to the uninitialized state.
Returns the component identifier for the next registered component that meets the selection criteria specified by your application.
A format specification for an audio stream.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A raw pointer for accessing untyped data.
